info.title: Kwasu VTE
info.description: API documentation for managing Kwara State University Vocational Training System

get.description:
Retrieves a list of all academic sessions including both active and inactive ones.
The response includes session details such as name, start/end dates, and active status.

post.description:
Creates a new academic session with the provided details. The session will be
created in an inactive state by default.

Ensure academic session dates are in the future i.e. after today.

Activates the specified academic session and automatically deactivates any
currently active session.

- An academic session expires when it's end date is already less than or equal to today
Deactivates the specified academic session. Only currently active sessions can be ended.

Enroll a student user for a particular skill in the current active session.
There must be an active academic session and it's must still be valid (not expired)

**Enrollment Status**

skill_id.description: The skill the student wants to enroll for

get.description: Get the enrollment made for this particular student

post.description:
- If the `enrollment id` is null (null, not 0) the system will automatically check if there is an existing enrollment for the user,
- if none, it enrolls the student in a random skill that their level can take
- Creates a payment record for the enrollment  and returns payment details including the payment gateway URL.

get.description:
`Admin:` Get all enrollments made for a particular academic session and/or skill including
some details of the student and the skill.

- If no `academic_session_id` is specified, the current active session will be used.
- If no `skill_id` is specified, all skill enrollments during that session will be included.
- Results are paginated.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of items per page for pagination

get.description: `Admin:` Get a comprehensive detail about a particular enrollment using it's ID

`Strictly Owner:` Initiate payment for a particular enrollment using the enrollment ID.
- Creates a payment record and returns payment details including the payment gateway URL.
- Only the owner of the enrollment can initiate this request.

message.example: Payment can only be initiated by the owner of this enrollment

post.description:
This endpoint handles QR code generation for a given `SkillGroup`.
- If the quantity is small (â‰¤ 5), QR codes are generated synchronously and returned immediately.
- If the quantity is large (> 5), the generation is queued as a background job and a `job_id` is returned,
  allowing the frontend to poll for completion or notify the user later.
- An email will be sent to notify the job creator of the job completion.
post.summary: Generate QR codes for a specific skill group

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: The skill group for which the QR codes are being generated.

post.description:
This endpoint queues a job that generates QR codes in bulk for every group
under the specified skill. It is designed for heavy operations and will
always run asynchronously in the background.
post.summary: Bulk generate QR codes for all groups in a given skill

get.summary: Get scan history for a QR code

get.description: `Mentor or Admin` Endpoint to generate attendance report for a specific group.
get.summary: Get attendance report for a group

get.description: `Mentor or Admin` endpoint to list QR codes for a specific group.
get.summary: List QR codes for a group with pagination

post.description:
This endpoint processes a scanned QR code and records attendance for a student.

- Verifies the QR code exists and is not expired.
- Confirms the student is enrolled in the relevant skill group.
- Prevents duplicate attendance for the same day.
- Records attendance and awards the associated mark value.
post.summary: Process QR Code Scan for Attendance

enum: Student not enrolled in this group

get.summary: Get skills assigned to a mentor
Get skill groups for mentor's assigned skills

post.description: `Admin`: creates a new mentor profile. The mentor will receive an email containing their login details.
post.summary: Create a new Mentor in the system

get.description: `Admin`: retrieves all mentor profiles with pagination and filtering
get.summary: Get all mentors in the system

post.description: `Admin`: assigns a mentor to a specific skill
post.summary: Assign a mentor to a skill

post.description: `Admin`: removes a mentor from a specific skill

enum: Mentor is not assigned to this skill

get.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of all available skills in the system.
Each skill includes enrollment and group counts when available.

post.description:
Creates a new skill with the provided configuration. Skills can have various
restrictions including student group limits, date ranges, weekend exclusions,
and level-based access control.

get.description:
Retrieves detailed information about a specific skill by its ID.
Includes all skill configuration, metadata, and related counts.

patch.description:
Updates an existing skill with new configuration data. All fields are optional
and only provided fields will be updated. The skill's groups and enrollments
may be affected by certain configuration changes.

delete.description:
Permanently deletes a skill from the system. This action cannot be undone.
All associated groups and enrollments will also be removed. Use with caution.

post.description:
In the **current academic session**, update a particular range at which this skill
will be holding practicals. The date range must be between the range of dates of the
academic session and must be after today. Note that practical dates will be assigned
to group from the skill date range.

date_range_start.description: The date when this skill will start practicals (in the current academic session)

date_range_end.description: The date when this skill will end practicals

get.description:
Get the date range for this skill in the current academic session
You may optionally provide the academic session id if you want to get for another academic session
else the system will automatically get for the current session.

parameters.name: academic-session
parameters.description: The practical date range for this skill in this academic session id.

get.description:
`Admin`: Retrieves a paginated list of all skill groups, optionally filtered by skill,
academic session, or other criteria. Includes student counts and status information.

post.description:
`Admin`: Creates a new skill group for a specific skill and academic session.
Automatically generates group number and initializes practical dates if applicable.

get.description:
`Admin`: Retrieves detailed information about a specific skill group including
all enrolled students, practical schedules, and capacity information.

delete.description:
`Admin`: Permanently deletes a skill group. All enrolled students will be unassigned
and may need to be reassigned to other groups. Use with caution. âš ï¸

post.description:
`Admin`: Manually assigns a specific student (enrollment) to this skill group.
The student must have paid status and not already be assigned to a group.

delete.description:
`Admin`: Removes a student from this skill group, changing their enrollment status
back to PAID and making them available for reassignment.

get.description:
Provides statistical overview of skill groups including capacity utilization,
distribution metrics, and assignment status summaries.

Retrieves all groups for a specific skill, optionally filtered by academic session.
Useful for displaying skill-specific group management interfaces.

post.description:
Automatically assigns all unassigned paid students for a skill to groups
using the specified algorithm (fill_sequentially).
A cron Job already does this now and then.

Create a new student profile for the user.
- If the authenticated user is not an admin, then the `user` id in the param must belong to the authenticated user.
- The `user` id must also belong to a student (a user with the student role)
- âš ï¸ Only admins can update certain field after creation including; department, faculty, matric number
Therefore, students are advised to open their eyes when creating their profile

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The user id of the user you want to create a student profile for

get.description: Get the current authenticated user's student profile.
Get the available skills this student can register for based on their level and as set by admin

enum: Here are the skills you can enroll for

get.description: Get the list of all student on the system

post.summary: Get a JWT via given credentials

post.description:
This endpoint is used to register a new student.
The `student` role will be assigned to the user registered.

post.summary: Log the user out (Invalidate the token)

groups_count.description: Include groups count if relationship is loaded

mark_value.description: Number of marks awarded for each scan. Default: 10. (optional)

codes_per_group.description: Number of QR codes to generate per group. Default: 1, Max: 10. (optional)

expires_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the QR codes should expire. (optional)

skill_mentorships.description: Skill mentorships (more detailed relationship info) including assignments that are not active

max_groups.description: The maximum number of groups the skill should always have

min_students_per_group.description:
The minimum number of student that should be in a particular skill group.
This is the actual number student we want in the group

max_students_per_group.description: Optionally, you can set the max number if student that should however be in a group.

allowed_levels.description: An array of the levels that are allowed to take this skills. If empty, it is assumed everyone can take it

mentor_assignment.description: Mentor assignment details (when loaded from mentor context)

max_groups.description: The maximum number of groups the skill should always have

min_students_per_group.description:
The minimum number of student that should be in a particular skill group.
This is the actual number student we want in the group

max_students_per_group.description: Optionally, you can set the max number if student that should however be in a group.

allowed_levels.description: An array of the levels that are allowed to take this skills

errors.description: A detailed description of each field that failed validation.
